title: BronxWorks Food Pantry
description: Free groceries and emergency food assistance for Bronx families. No documentation required. Serves over 1,000 families monthly.

title: Concourse Plaza Multipurpose Center
description: Hot meals served twice weekly. Special programs for seniors and families with children. Community dining room available.

title: Part of the Solution (POTS)
description: Daily hot meals plus job training, housing assistance, and social services. Comprehensive support for individuals and families.

title: BronxWorks Emergency Shelter
description: Emergency shelter for families experiencing homelessness. Case management, job placement, and permanent housing assistance available.

title: Bronx Legal Services
description: Free legal assistance for housing issues, eviction prevention, and tenant rights. Representation in housing court available.

title: Urban Justice Center - Homelessness Outreach
description: Street outreach, benefits assistance, and mental health services for individuals experiencing homelessness in the Bronx.

title: SoBRO Workforce Development
description: Free job training programs, career counseling, resume writing, and interview preparation. Partnerships with local employers.

title: Bronx Community College Workforce Development
description: Certificate programs in healthcare, technology, and skilled trades. Job placement assistance and continuing education opportunities.

title: Goodwill NYNJ Career Center
description: Job placement services, computer training, and career counseling. Special programs for individuals with disabilities.

title: Bronx Library Center
description: Free computer and internet access, study spaces, educational programs, and job search assistance. ESL and GED prep classes available.

title: Bronx Educational Opportunity Center
description: Free GED preparation, high school equivalency testing, college preparation, and career training programs for adults.

title: Mott Haven Library
description: Computer lab, homework help for children, adult literacy programs, and free Wi-Fi. Community meeting spaces available.

title: BronxCare Behavioral Health
description: Comprehensive mental health services including individual therapy, group counseling, and crisis intervention. Sliding scale fees available.

title: Samaritan Village Counseling Center
description: Substance abuse treatment, addiction counseling, mental health services, and support groups. Outpatient and intensive programs available.

title: Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Mental Health
description: 24/7 emergency psychiatric services and outpatient mental health programs. Crisis intervention and stabilization services.

title: St. Augustine Food Pantry
description: Community food pantry operated by St. Augustine Church. Emergency food packages for families and individuals in need.

title: Women's Housing and Economic Development Corporation
description: Affordable housing development, homeownership counseling, and economic development programs specifically for women and families.

title: Bronx Works Career Center
description: Comprehensive career services including job placement, skills training, and employment support for Bronx residents.

title: Hostos Community College Continuing Education
description: Continuing education programs, ESL classes, workforce training, and college preparation courses for adult learners.

title: Bronx Mental Health Society
description: Community-based mental health services, peer support programs, and advocacy for individuals with mental health challenges.
